title: Dear Love...
text:
Dear Love,
I wanted to write you a short note. Just to let you know I was thinking about you. I hope your having a great time, but I wanted to let you know that I'm missing you. Missing the way only you can make me laugh with your silliness. And the way you snuggle up with me to watch a little late night tv, because neither of us could sleep. I miss singing in the car with you, on one of our last minute road trips. I just miss everything about you. Even the things I dont like so much. I still miss them because its a part of you and who you are. 
But since I haven't heard from you, I was wondering if you missed me too? After the Walking Dead premier I didn't have anyone to talk with about it. The only person I thought about was you. I hope you saw it, because if you did it would be something we did at the same time. And that would make me feel a little better, knowing that we watched something together, kinda. I know I'm not perfect, but I honestly hope your happy and wish you all the best.
If your feeling lonely, you can always talk to me, I'm a good listener, remember. Ok, well bye. I hope to hear from you soon, but if not take care.

Always,
Me 💋 💘

If you only knew how often you cross my mind, consuming my thoughts. I miss you even though I've never had you. Throughout my life I have been lucky enough to experience love and I have also learnt what it feels like to go without. The dull ache from loneliness courses through my body. The tears have spilt out of my eyes landing on my pillow because sometimes it's too much to take. I know exactly how much I have to give to you. Craving so desperately your gentle embrace, just tight enough that I won't slip away but light enough to give me the room I need to breath. Wanting to drink you in and escape into you. I often sit alone at my table eating the food I've prepared looking at your empty spot, wishing for your companionship. Those easy going conversations and comfortable silences. Have I had you, only for you to slip away? Are you searching for me right now? 
I've looked for you time and time again always coming up short. Where will we find each other? Online? Will we see each other somewhere and recognize a safe place in one another's eyes? title: Dear Mr Rightttttttt
text:
Hello If you only knew how often you cross my mind, consuming my thoughts. I miss you even though I've never had you. Throughout my life I have been lucky enough to experience love and I have also learnt what it feels like to go without. The dull ache from loneliness courses through my body. The tears have spilt out of my eyes landing on my pillow because sometimes it's too much to take. I know exactly how much I have to give to you. 
Craving so desperately your gentle embrace, just tight enough that I won't slip away but light enough to give me the room I need to breath. Wanting to drink you in and escape into you. 
I often sit alone at my table eating the food I've prepared looking at your empty spot, wishing for your companionship. Those easy going conversations and comfortable silences. Have I had you, only for you to slip away? Are you searching for me right now? 
I've looked for you time and time again always coming up short. Where will we find each other? Online? Will we see each other somewhere and recognize a safe place in one another's eyes? Oh my sweet, dear friend, my lover come to me. Let my words awaken you. I wait for you as patiently as I can possibly bear.

title: A New Year
text:
1st let me say I'm a totally cool chic, college educated, have had some absolute amazing positions in my career that most only dream about. I've learned that a career isn't what makes a person special no matter what others tell you. 
I'm actually more humble and kind than I am arrogant and uncaring of others thoughts and feelings.

So here comes the difficult part and never in a million years did I ever think I'd be in a situation where I would be seeking something a bit unorthodox. 
Bare with me while I gather my thoughts and try to cautiously govern what I'm about to say...............
I'd like to meet an attractive man between the age of 29-37
You must be a Non Smoker
Have a solid job or career
Own your own vehicle
Be completely straight 
Fully believe in God (Christian) not atheist, agnostic or anything else that I might of forgotten to list, oh did I say and not into anything Satanic? Yikes
You Must be healthy and range from fit to average 
If you are Military affiliated that works for me since my background is Military. Military just seems to mesh better with other Military types.

If you like dogs that's cool since I'm thinking about getting one. 
I have a cool pad, my own vehicle and my own income. 
I'm average looking and I'm considered attractive average. I believe confidence and high self esteem go a long way and make a difference. 
I don't drink, do drugs and I'm 100% positive I am disease free so you be too.

I'm a chic that can clock anyone, female or male if need be. However brawls are not what I seek. I was raised with manners and proper etiquette has been instilled within me. 

In short something has come up where I need to have someone else with me for a bit to help make me feel secure, safe and protected while at home.
Oh and I'm going to install locks where there were none and I'm changing the others. Invasion of any kind whether it be home invasion, personal invasion or any other intrusions or acts that make a person not feel safe is pure evil, especially if it may not be a stranger. 
I'm very new to this area and haven't really met anyone yet. 
It would be nice if you know how to shoot and you wouldn't mind teaching me how to shoot. I prefer a rifle 1st before a handgun but that can be discussed. In the past I haven't had very good aim but I'm looking to improve. 

That is all I'm willing to share in reference to the circumstances I'm posting about on CL. 
I'm sitting here telling myself this is ridiculous but at this point what do I really have to lose? I definitely can sense a predator type whether they seem charming or not and my personal space and comfort zone has already been violated. 
My thoughts now are Freck it!!! I seek to have someone with me most nights until I get things sorted out. 
Also do understand I hate drama, I go out of my way to avoid drama and I do expect you to have very little drama. I'm only going to deal with the average normal % of drama that just comes with life. Otherwise stay out of my life. 
Yep, I'm not like most chics, in fact I think I'm a lot cooler than many of them. 
I'm good to those who are good to me. 
Others that I'm good to and I give them no name to place with a kind person who's helped them when in need, well that's between God and I.
So if you think you can hangout with me without too many questions asked and just enjoy one day at a time send me a response that has more than one sentence in it. 
Tell me about yourself and why I can have some initial trust in you and feel safe!?! Include a photo or I WILL ABSOLUTELY NOT RESPOND BACK!
Trust me when I say I'm highly intelligent and I'm fully aware how odd and nuts this post seems. Somethings are better not explained and that's where I stand on the subject at this time. If you are intelligent you'll have a good enough understanding on your own. 
Don't ask me my age just know I'm in my 30's, good to go!
Happy New Year!

title: Friendship, flirting...and then...
text:
It's funny, because all these new-fangled apps and websites keep cropping up, like Tinder and Zoosk and whatever else, but rather than making things easier, I think they've actually made things worse. People's attention spans are down to nothing. No one wants to get to know each other, they just want to fuck. Why bother nurturing anything with potential when there's something new and shiny a swipe away?

I suppose I'm an old fashioned girl in that I'm just looking for someone sweet, down to earth and funny. Someone I can have good conversations with, someone with a good head on their shoulders. Someone who is up for cuddling and adventures, staying in, going out, and fun - both in AND out of the bedroom. You know, like a normal relationship, where you spend time together, talk, get to know each other....

Maybe CL is the wrong place to look, too. Who knows? But it's worth a shot. I need a good, normal, sane man who is maybe equally disillusioned by how available "dating" is nowadays.

If you are between 25 and 40, have your shit together, are feeling lonely and want something more than just a hookup...then here's what you'll get in me. A sarcastic, sassy, energetic, cute and smart woman. Chubby, 27, a gamer, a geek, an intellectual, who enjoys movies, video games, cooking, being outside, live music, reading and a whole lot more. Sexy and sensual, caring, passionate, loyal, a chatterbox, a coffee addict and looking for the right guy (in all the wrong places).

Send me a message with "Old School Love" in the title and let me know about you! Maybe we can catch a spark that'll turn into something bigger. Your picture gets mine :)

title: Sitting here in my hammock chair. ..
text:
That I just randomly threw up with some old bailing wire, burning trash, and watching the kids play at the big nice houses behind our old trailer house (because that's all I can afford after we left my abusive husband a few months back), thinking about how much I miss (and feel my kids deserve) the times where we had a nice home, a trampoline, and were able to afford trash service. After all, I served him like a King. I miss those times too. Every day my kids beg me to homeschool them, but I can't because I have to find another job (since I lost mine 2 weeks before Christmas), just so I can afford to feed them. Just reminiscing over all the good times, but learning to be content in ALL circumstances. One thing that they have at the 2 homes behind me that I NEVER had, was a husband out there playing with his kids, while the wife socialized with friends before jumping in to join. As I sit here, cold and lonely, burning trash, I am reminded this isn't forever. Perhaps when I learn to be completely content and joyous in ALL situations, perhaps then, HE will deliver us from this mess. 

Don`t really have a point in posting; just needed to vent. Perhaps someone out there has been there, and has some words of encouragement, cause I'm going to need them lol. =/

Y'all have a wonderful day. God bless =)

title: Cosmic Connection
text: I know that I can easily expect several e-mails letting me know what I'm looking for is not on CL, but I like to hit all my bases. I'm looking to find someone I can build a connection with, build a friendship with, and hopefully a meaningful adult relationship with. I'm at a point in my life where I can honestly say I have what I need. I have a good job, good friends, supportive family, and a mind that has served me well so far. The thing about love and relationships is that you can't set up goals the way you would for anything else. While it would be nice to end up in a LTR, possibly leading to marriage and children, it's nothing that I can force. If I don't care who the person is, I can, as you can, get married within six month. I see it happen everyday. I however, am possibly like you, waiting for a connection, a cosmic connection if you will. I haven't stopped thinking that there's someone out there I can get to know so well I can feel him. A relationship where when we walk in the room everyone says to themselves, "I wish I had that." A connection so strong that we can communicate from across the room without even speaking. A bond where I can intuitively tell something is wrong with the other. Don't get me wrong, I know that this type of relationship and intimacy, emotional, physical, intellectual, and spiritual, takes time...but we can't work toward it if we don't know each other. I could conclude with the cliche personals ad info, job, likes, dislikes, hobbies, kids, pets, etc., but I won't. I can't imagine that if you're looking for the same thing I am, that we don't have something in common we can build a relationship on.

title: The Real Deal
text:
Going to church doesn't make you a Christian any more than standing in a garage makes you a car. 

Experience is a wonderful thing. It enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again. 

Don't worry about what people think, they don't do it very often. 

If you look like your passport picture, you probably need the trip. 

No man has ever been shot while doing the dishes. 

Opportunities always look bigger going than coming. 

Eat well, stay fit, die anyway..... (But taking care of yourself makes the journey so much more rewarding.) 

If you are reading this, you may be closer to the end than you are to your beginning, so make the most of what's left. 

If any of this resonates with you, please introduce yourself. I won't bite, unless of course, you want me to.... 

I'm the real deal: Cute, bright, energetic, accomplished, generous, "been there, done that"....desirous of a worthy counterpart with whom to share my feminine charms and eclectic circles of friends. 

My soul mate loves to play as intensely as he loves his work. Enjoys helping around the house, (loves tools) and providing for his lover, and is not a snob. Intelligence is hot; but a sense of humor is vital. So are compassion, tolerance, generosity of spirit. and open-mindedness. 

I'm not interested in a passive person or hanging out with negativity. I'm a live-wire and hope to encounter and woo a man with an optimistic attitude, who is passionate and enjoys self-expression. We don't always need to agree. "Vive la difference!" Just be willing to share your views in an articulate way and be willing to consider a situation from another perspective. 

I want meet a man who truly enjoys the emotional and physical aspects of a relationship. I've already raised my children, who are successful, contributing members of society. This is not about merging assets and security. This is about happiness and finding a comfy fit. Will you raise your hand?

title: cautiously optimistic
text:
I want someone to start over with. Someone who, like me, is scarred but not bitter, hurting yet still hopeful. I do not believe that you will fix me, complete me, or fill the holes in my life. I do not believe I can fix you, complete you, or fill the holes in yours. We can't rescue each other. 

I cannot give a laundry list of traits I am looking for, because I have come to believe that relationships are not about what your partner can do for you, but about what you and your partner can build together. I don't need your money, I don't want reflected status from you, and I am not assessing your suitability as a father (edited to add: I do not want children, but have an open heart if you have some). I do want you to be my lover, my confidante, my fiercest supporter, and a very close friend. I want to be those things for you in return.

I want to build a safe, warm relationship with you, filled with honesty, but with plenty of space to fail. With intimacy and closeness, but with the solemn promise to be the guardians of one another's solitude. I want to build a loving community around ourselves, and to create a space for constant self-improvement and learning. 

We can be partners in crime, and really good quiet-time companions. Let's skip down the street, try something new, have a deep conversation, and take a nap together -- preferably in the same day.

I have a big, open heart, a willing laugh, and a thirsty brain. I am curious to know everything about you, and quirks are way more interesting to me than perfection. I want to know where you have been before you met me, and I want to walk in the same direction together going forward. Take my hand, and we'll figure it out together.

title: Where's my future husband lol
text:
Hi! 
This is a total shot in the dark, but if I don't try, I'll never know. 
Don't mistake me for crazy, I'm just tired of wasting time. I'm really a sweet, open minded person. & yes, this is going to be a long read, sorry lol.

I'm looking for someone, who has the want to get married and have children. Whether it's next year or in 5 years. You can have children, I have one. I absolutely love kids. I want someone who understands fully what marriage entails, and respects it 100%. Who understands that if we ever went left, we could be friends until we got back right. I want one marriage, and although I can't fight a divorce, and I won't, I don't believe in it at all. Intimacy is also so important to me, it's not just about sex, and I need someone who understands what real intimacy is.

Anyways, before I keep rambling about marriage and kids and scare you off, I am totally fine with meeting and seeing where things go, that's usually how this goes ;) I just don't want to date someone who doesn't desire those things. 


IF YOU CAN TAKE SARCASM AND THROW IT BACK, call me lol.

Anyways, 
Hi! My name is Kate. I'm a single mom, I work at Boeing in Seattle (I am currently in the process of buying a home in Texas) I use to live next to SAFB, in Wichita falls. I'm currently going to school to get an MBA. (Masters of business of administration) I just sold my business. I am not fat or chubby, I work out 5 times a week, but I'm definitely curvy after having a child lol. My dad is my best friend, he raised me basically all alone. I don't believe in what Christianity has become, but I was baptized Christian & I do believe in God, whether you do or not, is not a big deal to me. Im not the kind of person to force my opinions on people, and i like people for who they are, I would never try to change anyone I come across. However, I love hearing people's opinions, educating and being educated on different things. I love to conversate, but I also like quiet nights too. I have a 3 year old, the sweetest person you will ever meet, she is a total tomboy cowgirl lol. She is apart of everything I do, and I raise her mostly alone. Her dad sees her sometimes but probably won't be seeing her much after we move. &No! There is absolutely no drama there. We are respectful to each other and the situations we are in. We have been separated for 3 years now. I love to be active! I also like some lazy days. I wear blue jeans and tshirts often, but I love getting dolled up :) I love Camping, four wheeling, hiking, working out. I'm an avid figure skater, for the last 13 years. I love HOCKEY! title: Curvy and Herpes
text:
I posted this before as "Curvy and Herpes, what more could you want?" but it seemed to invite people to ridicule my situation, so I tries something different in the title. (then it got flagged. If I'm not your thing that's cool, but I'm real and those std sites are not used much ) Same post though as it is still true:

Let's just cut to the chase: Herpes is either a big deal to you, or not.
So if you have educated yourself, you know that it is difficult to pass (2-4% chance from woman to man) but I just need to you be cool with it or have it yourself. I've had it a couple years but never had an outbreak, so it isn't on my radar until I have to have the "talk" with someone and it is just not something I want to have to keep doing. Getting it out in the open is much easier. Okay, on to things that actually matter to those of you who got this far. . .
I'm 50 years old, divorced with grown children. I am looking for love /connection /LTR, BUT we all know that starts with friendship. Age range.. Probably above 35.. I've dated most races(I'm white) and really it's all about being similar enough to relate and different enough to be interesting. I love my life and I'm looking for a connection. While I have my act together, I find I am always learning and growing and finding new things I want to try or learn about. Not daily, but I'm an open-minded person. title: Accepting Applications for Best Guy Friend!
text:
Hey there!

So usually I wouldn't even think to post on craigslist, unless I wanted some kind of excitement in my life so I figured why not? We only live once right? 

A little bit about me: I'm a chubby, pretty Hispanic young woman who enjoys professional wrestling and The Walking Dead. I'm fairly intelligent about some subjects (like animals OMFG who doesn't love animals?) and others not so much (politics are interesting but they do bore me). I currently do work, but I'm at a point in my life I want to make a career out of the place I'm working at and not simply just work there just to work there, so I am looking for other jobs at the moment as well. I was born and raised in good old Texas, and pretty much have the kind, friendly Texan attitude everyone is installed with. I'm shy when you first get to know me, but after I get comfortable I can be wild, random and pretty outgoing. :) I like just about every type of music out there, but my all time favorites have to be Bon Jovi and Def Leppard. Classic rock is the bomb case closed! 

I am a straight edge Christian, but don't let the title fool you. I'm not going to thump the Bible over your head or try to "save" you, nor am I going to judge you because you prefer to drink and smoke weed or do drugs. Personally, I could really care less who people believe in or what they do, because ultimately what you do in life is...well your business. I have friends who aren't Christians, who drink, who smoke, who've done some hardcore shit, and even though I can give an opinion I still respect everyone's decision to do what they want. The only things I ask is that you give me the same respect, and don't pressure me to do anything. I don't mind people drinking in front of me or even casually smoking a cigar or cigarette, but smoking weed or doing drugs in front of me is something I won't tolerate. 

Now that you have some kind of sense about me, let me explain my situation: Currently I am in a relationship, but there's something missing. My boyfriend is less affectionate and less caring than he originally was with me, and we are struggling. We both don't want to break up with each other, but there's a lot of clashing between us. I came down to the fact I NEED a distraction. Someone to sweep me off my feet, and just accept me for me. Be there for me not only physically, but mentally and emotionally. 

Do I want a side relationship? Yes. Do I want a side boyfriend on the down low? Yes. That is the kind of distraction I need, and possibly it may even help me rekindle my relationship now. Honestly, I'm looking for, in lack of better words, a best guy friend. Somebody I can laugh with, hang out with, go to for advice, snuggle with, make out with, and maybe even have sex with. I do want some kind of connection, not a "lets fuck and leave" situation. I would like to be spoiled every now and then by this best guy friend, but let's be clear I'm not looking for a sugar daddy.

I'm interested in men older than me (I am 22, 23 in April), and as long as you're good looking and/or fairly interesting I have no age limit. I will admit I'm very attracted to white men who are taller than me (I'm 5'2") and have either an athletic or stocky built (but generally body type doesn't matter to me as long as you're healthy and carry yourself well). 

If you've made it this far and seem pretty interested definitely send me an email! Let's get to know each other and see where it goes! Put you're favorite animal in the subject line so I can weed out the spam. PLEASE INCLUDE A PIC IN YOUR REPLY. And I will send one back in return. I'm real, Wrestlemania 32 is coming to Dallas and no robot can say that :P

title: Dating LTR/Romance Needed
text:
I have really bad scars from an accident I had as a child. **The photo is a picture of an ex model turned burnsurvivor named Turia Pitt. ** I read about her story and how her relationship was able to pull through the trauma of her accident. Although it's a bit of a reach for me, I am hopeful that despite the absence of the right guy, its possible for me too. 

So coupled with the outcome of my injury and growing up in a conservative household, I consider myself a bit of a late bloomer. The scars on my face are my biggest regret because as you can imagine people's stares aren't always kind. So in anticipation of eye contact, I tend to look away. Trust me, I'm working on it and it's getting better with time. 

My personality is adaptable. In many instances like work and school, I'm a social butterfly and a relatively confident person. But when it comes to social environments where I'm meeting people who aren't familiar with me and especially where dating or flirting happens, I tend to flounder and not know what to do... While this seems like a venting session, I'd like to hope there's someone who's out there who can relate and or want to get to know me, despite the obvious challenges I'm getting over.

I have made some strides in the dating area, I guess. The other day I met someone I was chatting with from tinder and it went fine. We met once after a few days and then another time after a few weeks of talking. I just don't think it's going anywhere because subtle things indicated that he didn't respect me or my time... I'll leave it at that. But for some reason a few days after the second meet up we just stopped checking in. Despite that upset, I did learn through that experience that in spite of feeling singled out and unlovable; I realized how many, if not all people sometimes feel that way. 

Simply put by a bar buddy I met at the Continental Dinner while waiting forty-five minutes for my date to arrive (oops, I said I wouldn't get into that), the buddy said we all have scars and experience trauma. Its just that some of your scars show on the outside. As simple and obvious as that may seem, it meant the world to me to feel that even for a second, I wasn't as different as my appearance and interactions lead me to sometimes feel and believe. Needless to say, I'm working on myself but am certainly not a push over (so you preying wolf, stay away!) 

If you're interested in getting to know someone like myself and maybe hangout, shoot me a message by telling me about yourself and attach a picture of yourself. Here's some of the things I hope you're like:

Friendly, Respectful
Single, No kids, Never married
Educated, Employed, Ambitious
27-35 age **
5'9 height or taller *
Stylish/Well groomed

More About Me----> I'll send you my picture once you send yours. I'm an African American educated female, 5'10, slim build, dark toned skin, and I have a great smile. I know it may seem like I'm asking for a lot but hey why limit your hearts desire. Prayers up. :) Thats it for now...

title: Why not?
text:
I think I'm just realizing that my circle is pretty small, and perhaps I should expand it. For the most part I'm pretty satisfied with my life, but obviously something is lacking or I wouldn't be scoping out cl ads. I've got kids(17 and 5), some massive home improvement projects, and what I hope will grow into a small business. I manage to stay pretty busy with a flexible schedule. I take nothing for granted in my life and celebrate even the smallest of victories. You should have seen me after my living room was painted!

I've let these things distract me from putting myself out there to meet someone. I miss flirting and getting "thinking of you" text messages. I miss quality hugs and being touched by someone over 5yo.. I really do want a friend more than a relationship. Hell, I don't assume I'm anyone's type. Ohh there it is--the insecurity and fear of rejection. I'm a cancer so I default to nurturing. I don't want to "mommy" a grown man, at the same time I'm all about bringing soup when someone is sick. 

Maybe we'll click enough to take it beyone email. What do you have to lose?

title: Dating LTR/Romance Needed
text:
I have really bad scars from an accident I had as a child. **The photo is a picture of an ex model turned burnsurvivor named Turia Pitt. ** I read about her story and how her relationship was able to pull through the trauma of her accident. Although it's a bit of a reach for me, I am hopeful that despite the absence of the right guy, its possible for me too. 

So coupled with the outcome of my injury and growing up in a conservative household, I consider myself a bit of a late bloomer. The scars on my face are my biggest regret because as you can imagine people's stares aren't always kind. So in anticipation of eye contact, I tend to look away. Trust me, I'm working on it and it's getting better with time. 

My personality is adaptable. In many instances like work and school, I'm a social butterfly and a relatively confident person. But when it comes to social environments where I'm meeting people who aren't familiar with me and especially where dating or flirting happens, I tend to flounder and not know what to do... While this seems like a venting session, I'd like to hope there's someone who's out there who can relate and or want to get to know me, despite the obvious challenges I'm getting over.

I have made some strides in the dating area, I guess. The other day I met someone I was chatting with from tinder and it went fine. We met once after a few days and then another time after a few weeks of talking. I just don't think it's going anywhere because subtle things indicated that he didn't respect me or my time... I'll leave it at that. But for some reason a few days after the second meet up we just stopped checking in. Despite that upset, I did learn through that experience that in spite of feeling singled out and unlovable; I realized how many, if not all people sometimes feel that way. 

Simply put by a bar buddy I met at the Continental Dinner while waiting forty-five minutes for my date to arrive (oops, I said I wouldn't get into that), the buddy said we all have scars and experience trauma. Its just that some of your scars show on the outside. As simple and obvious as that may seem, it meant the world to me to feel that even for a second, I wasn't as different as my appearance and interactions lead me to sometimes feel and believe. Needless to say, I'm working on myself but am certainly not a push over (so you preying wolf, stay away!) 

If you're interested in getting to know someone like myself and maybe hangout, shoot me a message by telling me about yourself and attach a picture of yourself. Here's some of the things I hope you're like:

Friendly, Respectful
Single, No kids, Never married
Educated, Employed, Ambitious
27-35 age **
5'9 height or taller *
Stylish/Well groomed

More About Me----> I'll send you my picture once you send yours. I'm an African American educated female, 5'10, slim build, dark toned skin, and I have a great smile. I know it may seem like I'm asking for a lot but hey why limit your hearts desire. Prayers up. :) Thats it for now...

title: Accepting Applications for Best Guy Friend!
text:
Hey there!

So usually I wouldn't even think to post on craigslist, unless I wanted some kind of excitement in my life so I figured why not? We only live once right? 

A little bit about me: I'm a chubby, pretty Hispanic young woman who enjoys professional wrestling and The Walking Dead. I'm fairly intelligent about some subjects (like animals OMFG who doesn't love animals?) and others not so much (politics are interesting but they do bore me). I currently do work, but I'm at a point in my life I want to make a career out of the place I'm working at and not simply just work there just to work there, so I am looking for other jobs at the moment as well. I was born and raised in good old Texas, and pretty much have the kind, friendly Texan attitude everyone is installed with. I'm shy when you first get to know me, but after I get comfortable I can be wild, random and pretty outgoing. :) I like just about every type of music out there, but my all time favorites have to be Bon Jovi and Def Leppard. Classic rock is the bomb case closed! 

I am a straight edge Christian, but don't let the title fool you. I'm not going to thump the Bible over your head or try to "save" you, nor am I going to judge you because you prefer to drink and smoke weed or do drugs. Personally, I could really care less who people believe in or what they do, because ultimately what you do in life is...well your business. I have friends who aren't Christians, who drink, who smoke, who've done some hardcore shit, and even though I can give an opinion I still respect everyone's decision to do what they want. The only things I ask is that you give me the same respect, and don't pressure me to do anything. I don't mind people drinking in front of me or even casually smoking a cigar or cigarette, but smoking weed or doing drugs in front of me is something I won't tolerate. 

Now that you have some kind of sense about me, let me explain my situation: Currently I am in a relationship, but there's something missing. My boyfriend is less affectionate and less caring than he originally was with me, and we are struggling. We both don't want to break up with each other, but there's a lot of clashing between us. I came down to the fact I NEED a distraction. Someone to sweep me off my feet, and just accept me for me. Be there for me not only physically, but mentally and emotionally. 

Do I want a side relationship? Yes. Do I want a side boyfriend on the down low? Yes. That is the kind of distraction I need, and possibly it may even help me rekindle my relationship now. Honestly, I'm looking for, in lack of better words, a best guy friend. Somebody I can laugh with, hang out with, go to for advice, snuggle with, make out with, and maybe even have sex with. I do want some kind of connection, not a "lets fuck and leave" situation. I would like to be spoiled every now and then by this best guy friend, but let's be clear I'm not looking for a sugar daddy.

I'm interested in men older than me (I am 22, 23 in April), and as long as you're good looking and/or fairly interesting I have no age limit. I will admit I'm very attracted to white men who are taller than me (I'm 5'2") and have either an athletic or stocky built (but generally body type doesn't matter to me as long as you're healthy and carry yourself well). 

If you've made it this far and seem pretty interested definitely send me an email! Let's get to know each other and see where it goes! Put you're favorite animal in the subject line so I can weed out the spam. PLEASE INCLUDE A PIC IN YOUR REPLY. And I will send one back in return. I'm real, Wrestlemania 32 is coming to Dallas and no robot can say that :P

title: From friend to LTR
text:
Hello CL,

I'm a single mom looking for a friend to hang out with, that has the potential to become more later on. 

First, let me tell you a little bit more about myself:

•	I'm 22, but I've been told I'm very mature for my age. Unfortunately, I'm still undecided when it comes to knowing what I want out of a relationship. I DO know that I'm NOT looking for a fwb, a hook up, or anything that involves meaningless sex.
•	I've only been in a couple relationships (serious or otherwise), due to the simple reason that I haven't been looking. 
•	I'm not fat, but I'm not skinny either. I'm more pudgy than anything. There are times I diet and times I don't. Same thing with exercise. I don't consider myself ugly or beautiful. You can judge for yourself. (Pic4pic)
•	I enjoy reading and writing original stories. I'm hoping to attend college soon so I can major in English and maybe get a degree in child care too.
•	I sometimes watch popular tv shows (Doctor Who, Once Upon A Time, Criminal Minds, etc), as well as anime (Naruto, Attack on Titan, etc). Occasionally, I'll play video games too (Legend of Zelda, Kingdom Hearts, Mortal Combat, etc). Keyword: sometimes.

Now let me give you a list of preferences (because we all have them). I'm looking for someone:

•	Between the ages of 22-29.
•	Who has their own car and a job. (I do not have a place of my own because I'm helping my recently divorced mom take care of my younger siblings. So it'd be really nice if you had your own place so that we could have the option of hanging out somewhere private.)
•	Mature, respectful, and patient. (No jerks please.)
•	Not obese. (I'm not particularly picky, but I have my limits.)
•	Light complected (not racist; just a preference.)
•	Who is okay with me being a mom first. I have a 3 year old son that comes before everything else in my life. Even if we were to start a serious relationship, my son would always be first.

I think I've finished ranting. If you're interested, e-mail me a current picture and more about yourself. Don't be discouraged if I don't reply right away. My working and sleeping schedule can be a bit chaotic since I work the graveyard shift sometimes.

Please put your name and age as the subject line.

title: Do you want to feel this way?
text:
What do we really think we can find here on CL? Do we think we will fill the needs that we have? Is it just a fantasy? Is it the lust that is not in our marriages anymore? I am honestly not entirely sure what I expect to find here on CL. It would be nice to find someone to share a quality, emotional, and passionate friendship with, but how does that start on the internet? It seems almost impossible to weed through it all and find someone who matches your desires. 

I want to experience passion with a man again. I want to lust after you and for you to lust after me. I want to daydream about you, the smell of your hair, the sparkle in your eyes, the taste of you, the feel of you, the warmth of your body. 

While this is something I would not base solely on looks, I think there should be a match between both people. I would like to find someone similar to myself who is athletic, slim and attractive. I would also like to find someone who is smart, honest, fun, humorous, sexy and not afraid to share.

title: Friend/LTR
text:
Hello CL,

I'm a single mom looking for someone to hang out with, that has the potential to become more later on. 

First, let me tell you a little bit more about myself:

•	I'm 22, but I've been told I'm very mature for my age. Unfortunately, I'm still undecided when it comes to knowing what I want out of a relationship. I DO know that I'm NOT looking for a fwb, a hook up, or anything that involves meaningless sex.
•	I've only been in a couple relationships (serious or otherwise), due to the simple reason that I haven't been looking. 
•	I'm not fat, but I'm not skinny either. There are times I diet and times I don't. Same thing with exercise. I don't consider myself ugly or beautiful. You can judge for yourself. (Pic4pic)
•	I enjoy reading and writing original stories. I'm hoping to attend college soon so I can major in English and maybe get a degree in child care too. Right now, I'm a part-time waitress at a family-friendly restaurant.
•	I sometimes watch popular tv shows (Doctor Who, Once Upon A Time, Criminal Minds, etc), as well as anime (Naruto, Attack on Titan, etc). Occasionally, I'll play video games too (Legend of Zelda, Kingdom Hearts, Mortal Combat, etc).

Now let me give you a list of preferences (because we all have them). I'm looking for someone:

•	Between the ages of 22-29.
•	Who has their own car and a job. (I do not have a place of my own because I'm helping my recently divorced mom take care of my younger siblings. So it'd be really nice if you had your own place so that we could have the option of hanging out somewhere private.)
•	Mature, respectful, and patient. (No jerks please.)
•	Not obese. (I'm not particularly picky, but I have my limits.)
•	Light complected (just a preference.)
•	Who is okay with me being a mom first. I have a 3 year old son that comes before everything else in my life. Even if we were to start a serious relationship, my son would always be first.

I think I've finished ranting. If you're interested, e-mail me a current picture and more about yourself. Don't be discouraged if I don't reply right away. My working and sleeping schedule can be a bit chaotic since I work the graveyard shift sometimes.

Please put your name and age as the subject line.
